pr_title: [F] ENT-1829: Populate provided products and derived provided products

timeline.message:
ENT-1829: Populate provided products and derived provided products
into org.candlepin.dto.rules.v1.PoolDTO from product model

 - Updated Translator, JUnit and rspec files.

timeline.bodyText: These need to be n-tier aware translations
timeline.author: Ceiu

replies.bodyText:
@sonalidhome @Ceiu
Do we need to combined stacked entitlements provided products here like we are doing in other pool translators?
replies.author: abhiskum

replies.bodyText: @Ceiu Can you explain what you mean by "n-tier aware"?
replies.author: nikosmoum

replies.bodyText: Based on the brief discussion I posed the other day during post-scrum, these particular bits where we copy the products to the pool DTO should be recursive and grab provided products of the provided products.
replies.author: Ceiu

replies.bodyText: Updated the code to support n-tier.
replies.author: sonalidhome

timeline.bodyText: Add the provided product to the product itself up on line 2208.
timeline.author: Ceiu

timeline.bodyText: Add these to the product directly during product declaration.
timeline.author: Ceiu

timeline.message: n-tier and hosted test subscription service adapter changes
n-tier and hosted test subscription service adapter changes
n-tier and hosted test subscription service adapter changes
n-tier and hosted test subscription service adapter changes

ENT-1829: Populate provided products and derived provided products
into org.candlepin.dto.rules.v1.PoolDTO from product model

 - Updated Translator, JUnit and rspec files.

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think the new method resolveProvidedProducts is needed. We could simply use the existing resolveProduct/resolveProducts methods to lookup any existing provided products we have, assuming they were already created.
spec tests would have to make sure that the provided products are created first, and then create a marketing product that references them.
The only reason the resolveBranding method was created this way was because you can't really create a branding standalone. It is an entity fully owned by a product.
timeline.author: nikosmoum

replies.bodyText:
This was done to resolve 'verify branding info is correct in json blob' spec test. Provided product is created in non-hosted mode. When the marketing products get created in hosted mode, it doesn't recognize provided product in productMap. Hence for the solution, I added resolveProvidedProducts method.
Possible approaches :

As suggested, modify the spec test to create provided product before marketing product in hosted.
Keeping resolveProvidedProducts without identifying either the provided product is created in hosted or not.
replies.author: sonalidhome

replies.bodyText: We should use approach 1 because it is consistent with how the HostedTest adapter works so far. That test already has an if is_hosted? condition; you can use that to create the engineering product either in hosted or in normal mode.
replies.author: nikosmoum
